item.title: ‘The money went into his account’: Is my father trying to swindle me out of my grandparents’ $800K home?
item.description: “I came across a letter from my father’s bank showing a wire transfer of $195,000 from the buyer.”

item.title: Inflation and tariffs are hitting back-to-school spending. The stock market could be tested.
item.description: Many households continue to grapple with the higher costs of food, housing and other essentials

item.title: BJ’s sales come up short as customers ‘turn a bit more cautious.’ The stock is falling.
item.description: BJ’s saw members across all income levels pull back on spending during the quarter, according to CEO Bob Eddy.

item.title: Here’s the $863 billion secret Powell, Trump and Bessent aren’t telling us about gold and bitcoin
item.description: The inevitable gold-price reckoning that could fund Trump’s bitcoin ambitions — and sting your bank account.

item.title: Some experts claim recessions are ancient history. What will they say after the next one?
item.description: Hubris in the financial markets is most apparent when growth is robust and investors ignore the past.
